data:
[et_pb_section fb_built="1" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="#f8fafc" custom_padding="100px||100px||true|false" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_row _builder_version="4.27.0" max_width="1200px" custom_padding="0px||64px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="4.27.0" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="JetBrains Mono|500|||||||" text_text_color="#3798E4" text_font_size="11px" text_letter_spacing="3px" text_orientation="center" header_2_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_2_text_color="#253B50" header_2_font_size="44px" header_2_line_height="1.15em" global_colors_info="{}"]

For Manufacturing Business Owners

Do You Recognize These Problems?

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#64748b" text_font_size="18px" text_line_height="1.6em" text_orientation="center" max_width="600px" module_alignment="center" global_colors_info="{}"]

If any of these sound familiar, you’re not alone. We’ve helped 50,000+ factories escape these exact traps.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [/et_pb_row] [et_pb_row column_structure="1_3,1_3,1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" max_width="1200px" custom_padding="0px||32px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="#ffffff" custom_padding="40px|32px|40px|32px|true|true" border_radii="on|20px|20px|20px|20px" border_width_all="1px" border_color_all="#e2e8f0" box_shadow_style="preset1" box_shadow_blur="24px" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.04)" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Lexend|800|||||||" text_text_color="#3798E4" text_font_size="64px" custom_margin="||24px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

01

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" header_3_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_3_text_color="#253B50" header_3_font_size="20px" global_colors_info="{}"]

“Shadow Excel” Reality

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#475569" text_font_size="16px" text_font_style="italic" text_line_height="1.7em" border_width_left="3px" border_color_left="#3798E4" custom_padding="||0px|16px|false|false" custom_margin="||20px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

“You know your factory isn’t actually running on your current system—it’s running on spreadsheets because your staff finds the software too rigid or slow.”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#64748b" text_font_size="15px" text_line_height="1.6em" global_colors_info="{}"]

Your real operations live in unconnected Excel files, not in your ERP. Financial data doesn’t match physical reality because planners work outside the system.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="#ffffff" custom_padding="40px|32px|40px|32px|true|true" border_radii="on|20px|20px|20px|20px" border_width_all="1px" border_color_all="#e2e8f0" box_shadow_style="preset1" box_shadow_blur="24px" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.04)" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Lexend|800|||||||" text_text_color="#3798E4" text_font_size="64px" custom_margin="||24px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

02

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" header_3_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_3_text_color="#253B50" header_3_font_size="20px" global_colors_info="{}"]

“The Black Box” Problem

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#475569" text_font_size="16px" text_font_style="italic" text_line_height="1.7em" border_width_left="3px" border_color_left="#3798E4" custom_padding="||0px|16px|false|false" custom_margin="||20px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

“You know exactly how much raw material you bought and how many finished goods you sold, but the 3 weeks in between (WIP) are invisible.”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#64748b" text_font_size="15px" text_line_height="1.6em" global_colors_info="{}"]

You rely on paper reports filled out yesterday to understand what happened today. You can’t see what’s happening on the floor right now without walking over and asking.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="#ffffff" custom_padding="40px|32px|40px|32px|true|true" border_radii="on|20px|20px|20px|20px" border_width_all="1px" border_color_all="#e2e8f0" box_shadow_style="preset1" box_shadow_blur="24px" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.04)" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Lexend|800|||||||" text_text_color="#3798E4" text_font_size="64px" custom_margin="||24px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

03

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" header_3_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_3_text_color="#253B50" header_3_font_size="20px" global_colors_info="{}"]

“Ghost Inventory” Crisis

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#475569" text_font_size="16px" text_font_style="italic" text_line_height="1.7em" border_width_left="3px" border_color_left="#3798E4" custom_padding="||0px|16px|false|false" custom_margin="||20px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

“The system says you have 100 units, but the shelf has 50. This discrepancy forces your team to hoard ‘safety stock’ just to survive.”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#64748b" text_font_size="15px" text_line_height="1.6em" global_colors_info="{}"]

Inventory inaccuracy ties up millions in unnecessary capital and destroys your ability to promise reliable delivery dates. The “borrowing culture” has replaced discipline.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [/et_pb_row] [et_pb_row column_structure="1_3,1_3,1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" max_width="1200px" custom_padding="0px||0px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="#ffffff" custom_padding="40px|32px|40px|32px|true|true" border_radii="on|20px|20px|20px|20px" border_width_all="1px" border_color_all="#e2e8f0" box_shadow_style="preset1" box_shadow_blur="24px" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.04)" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Lexend|800|||||||" text_text_color="#3798E4" text_font_size="64px" custom_margin="||24px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

04

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" header_3_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_3_text_color="#253B50" header_3_font_size="20px" global_colors_info="{}"]

“Cost Guesswork” Trap

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#475569" text_font_size="16px" text_font_style="italic" text_line_height="1.7em" border_width_left="3px" border_color_left="#3798E4" custom_padding="||0px|16px|false|false" custom_margin="||20px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

“You quoted a price last month based on estimated costs. This month the same product costs 15% more to make—and you have no idea why.”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#64748b" text_font_size="15px" text_line_height="1.6em" global_colors_info="{}"]

Batch-to-batch cost fluctuations are invisible without production-order-level tracking. You’re pricing based on last quarter’s averages, not this morning’s reality.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" background_color="#ffffff" custom_padding="40px|32px|40px|32px|true|true" border_radii="on|20px|20px|20px|20px" border_width_all="1px" border_color_all="#e2e8f0" box_shadow_style="preset1" box_shadow_blur="24px" box_shadow_color="rgba(0,0,0,0.04)" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Lexend|800|||||||" text_text_color="#3798E4" text_font_size="64px" custom_margin="||24px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

05

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" header_3_font="Lexend|700|||||||" header_3_text_color="#253B50" header_3_font_size="20px" global_colors_info="{}"]

“10-Second Answer” Failure

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#475569" text_font_size="16px" text_font_style="italic" text_line_height="1.7em" border_width_left="3px" border_color_left="#3798E4" custom_padding="||0px|16px|false|false" custom_margin="||20px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"]

“When your biggest customer calls and asks ‘where is my order?’—you put them on hold, walk to the shop floor, and hope someone knows.”

[/et_pb_text] [et_pb_text _builder_version="4.27.0" text_font="Source Sans 3||||||||" text_text_color="#64748b" text_font_size="15px" text_line_height="1.6em" global_colors_info="{}"]

Real-time delivery status should be a click away, not a 20-minute investigation. Every hold costs you credibility with the customers who matter most.

[/et_pb_text] [/et_pb_column] [et_pb_column type="1_3" _builder_version="4.27.0" global_colors_info="{}"] [/et_pb_column] [/et_pb_row] [et_pb_row _builder_version="4.27.0" max_width="1200px" custom_padding="56px||0px||false|false" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_column type="4_4" _builder_version="4.27.0" global_colors_info="{}"] [et_pb_button button_url="/products/" button_text="See How We Fix This" button_alignment="center" _builder_version="4.27.0" custom_button="on" button_text_size="16px" button_text_color="#ffffff" button_bg_color="#3798E4" button_border_width="0px" button_border_radius="8px" button_font="Lexend|600|||||||" custom_padding="16px|32px|16px|32px|true|true" button_bg_color__hover_enabled="on|hover" button_bg_color__hover="#2d7bc4" global_colors_info="{}"] [/et_pb_button] [/et_pb_column] [/et_pb_row] [/et_pb_section]

info.name: DigiWin Homepage - Section 3: Factory Pain Points
info.description: Track A (factory operators) understanding checks. 5 pain point cards in a 3+2 grid layout. Each card has a large faded number, title, italic quote, and description. CTA at bottom.
divi_modules_used: et_pb_column (white bg, rounded corners, shadow, border)
notes: 5 cards: Shadow Excel, Black Box, Ghost Inventory, Cost Guesswork, 10-Second Answer
Row 2 has empty 3rd column as spacer (only 2 cards in second row)
Quote text uses left border accent (3px #3798E4) and italic style
Card numbers (01-05) are large and faded for visual hierarchy
